speaker: Herald
text_entry: SCENE III. A hall in the castle.

speaker: Herald
text_entry: Enter OTHELLO, DESDEMONA, CASSIO, and Attendants

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Good Michael, look you to the guard to-night:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Let's teach ourselves that honourable stop,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Not to outsport discretion.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Iago hath direction what to do;

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: But, notwithstanding, with my personal eye

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Will I look to't.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Iago is most honest.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Michael, good night: to-morrow with your earliest

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Let me have speech with you.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To DESDEMONA

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Come, my dear love,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The purchase made, the fruits are to ensue;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That profit's yet to come 'tween me and you.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Good night.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Exeunt OTHELLO, DESDEMONA, and Attendants

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Enter IAGO

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Welcome, Iago; we must to the watch.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Not this hour, lieutenant; 'tis not yet ten o' the

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: clock. Our general cast us thus early for the love

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: of his Desdemona; who let us not therefore blame:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: he hath not yet made wanton the night with her; and

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: she is sport for Jove.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: She's a most exquisite lady.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And, I'll warrant her, fun of game.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Indeed, she's a most fresh and delicate creature.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What an eye she has! methinks it sounds a parley of

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: provocation.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: An inviting eye; and yet methinks right modest.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And when she speaks, is it not an alarum to love?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: She is indeed perfection.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Well, happiness to their sheets! Come, lieutenant, I

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: have a stoup of wine; and here without are a brace

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: of Cyprus gallants that would fain have a measure to

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: the health of black Othello.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Not to-night, good Iago: I have very poor and

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: unhappy brains for drinking: I could well wish

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: courtesy would invent some other custom of

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: entertainment.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: O, they are our friends; but one cup: I'll drink for

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: you.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I have drunk but one cup to-night, and that was

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: craftily qualified too, and, behold, what innovation

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: it makes here: I am unfortunate in the infirmity,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: and dare not task my weakness with any more.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What, man! 'tis a night of revels: the gallants

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: desire it.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Where are they?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Here at the door; I pray you, call them in.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I'll do't; but it dislikes me.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: If I can fasten but one cup upon him,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: With that which he hath drunk to-night already,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He'll be as full of quarrel and offence

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As my young mistress' dog. Now, my sick fool Roderigo,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Whom love hath turn'd almost the wrong side out,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To Desdemona hath to-night caroused

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Potations pottle-deep; and he's to watch:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Three lads of Cyprus, noble swelling spirits,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That hold their honours in a wary distance,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: The very elements of this warlike isle,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Have I to-night fluster'd with flowing cups,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And they watch too. Now, 'mongst this flock of drunkards,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Am I to put our Cassio in some action

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That may offend the isle.--But here they come:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: If consequence do but approve my dream,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: My boat sails freely, both with wind and stream.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Re-enter CASSIO; with him MONTANO and Gentlemen; servants following with wine

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: 'Fore God, they have given me a rouse already.

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Good faith, a little one; not past a pint, as I am

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: a soldier.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Some wine, ho!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Sings

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And let me the canakin clink, clink;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And let me the canakin clink

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: A soldier's a man;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: A life's but a span;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Why, then, let a soldier drink.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Some wine, boys!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: 'Fore God, an excellent song.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I learned it in England, where, indeed, they are

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: most potent in potting: your Dane, your German, and

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: your swag-bellied Hollander--Drink, ho!--are nothing

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: to your English.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Is your Englishman so expert in his drinking?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Why, he drinks you, with facility, your Dane dead

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: drunk; he sweats not to overthrow your Almain; he

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: gives your Hollander a vomit, ere the next pottle

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: can be filled.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: To the health of our general!

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: I am for it, lieutenant; and I'll do you justice.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: O sweet England!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: King Stephen was a worthy peer,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: His breeches cost him but a crown;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He held them sixpence all too dear,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: With that he call'd the tailor lown.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He was a wight of high renown,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And thou art but of low degree:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: 'Tis pride that pulls the country down;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Then take thine auld cloak about thee.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Some wine, ho!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Why, this is a more exquisite song than the other.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Will you hear't again?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: No; for I hold him to be unworthy of his place that

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: does those things. Well, God's above all; and there

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: be souls must be saved, and there be souls must not be saved.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: It's true, good lieutenant.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: For mine own part,--no offence to the general, nor

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: any man of quality,--I hope to be saved.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And so do I too, lieutenant.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Ay, but, by your leave, not before me; the

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: lieutenant is to be saved before the ancient. Let's

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: have no more of this; let's to our affairs.--Forgive

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: us our sins!--Gentlemen, let's look to our business.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Do not think, gentlemen. I am drunk: this is my

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: ancient; this is my right hand, and this is my left:

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I am not drunk now; I can stand well enough, and

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: speak well enough.

speaker: All
text_entry: Excellent well.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Why, very well then; you must not think then that I am drunk.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: To the platform, masters; come, let's set the watch.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: You see this fellow that is gone before;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He is a soldier fit to stand by Caesar

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And give direction: and do but see his vice;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: 'Tis to his virtue a just equinox,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: The one as long as the other: 'tis pity of him.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I fear the trust Othello puts him in.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: On some odd time of his infirmity,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Will shake this island.

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: But is he often thus?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: 'Tis evermore the prologue to his sleep:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He'll watch the horologe a double set,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: If drink rock not his cradle.

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: It were well

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: The general were put in mind of it.

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Perhaps he sees it not; or his good nature

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Prizes the virtue that appears in Cassio,

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: And looks not on his evils: is not this true?

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Enter RODERIGO

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: [Aside to him]  How now, Roderigo!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I pray you, after the lieutenant; go.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Exit RODERIGO

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: And 'tis great pity that the noble Moor

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Should hazard such a place as his own second

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: With one of an ingraft infirmity:

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: It were an honest action to say

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: So to the Moor.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Not I, for this fair island:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I do love Cassio well; and would do much

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To cure him of this evil--But, hark! what noise?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Cry within: 'Help! help!'

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Re-enter CASSIO, driving in RODERIGO

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: You rogue! you rascal!

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: What's the matter, lieutenant?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: A knave teach me my duty!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I'll beat the knave into a twiggen bottle.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Beat me!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Dost thou prate, rogue?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Striking RODERIGO

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Nay, good lieutenant;

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Staying him

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: I pray you, sir, hold your hand.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Let me go, sir,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Or I'll knock you o'er the mazzard.

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Come, come,

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: you're drunk.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Drunk!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: They fight

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: [Aside to RODERIGO]  Away, I say; go out, and cry a mutiny.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Exit RODERIGO

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Nay, good lieutenant,--alas, gentlemen;--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Help, ho!--Lieutenant,--sir,--Montano,--sir;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Help, masters!--Here's a goodly watch indeed!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Bell rings

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Who's that which rings the bell?--Diablo, ho!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: The town will rise: God's will, lieutenant, hold!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: You will be shamed for ever.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Re-enter OTHELLO and Attendants

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What is the matter here?

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: 'Zounds, I bleed still; I am hurt to the death.

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Faints

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Hold, for your lives!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Hold, ho! Lieutenant,--sir--Montano,--gentlemen,--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Have you forgot all sense of place and duty?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Hold! the general speaks to you; hold, hold, for shame!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Why, how now, ho! from whence ariseth this?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Are we turn'd Turks, and to ourselves do that

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Which heaven hath forbid the Ottomites?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: For Christian shame, put by this barbarous brawl:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: He that stirs next to carve for his own rage

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Holds his soul light; he dies upon his motion.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Silence that dreadful bell: it frights the isle

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: From her propriety. What is the matter, masters?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Honest Iago, that look'st dead with grieving,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Speak, who began this? on thy love, I charge thee.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I do not know: friends all but now, even now,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: In quarter, and in terms like bride and groom

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Devesting them for bed; and then, but now--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As if some planet had unwitted men--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Swords out, and tilting one at other's breast,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: In opposition bloody. I cannot speak

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Any beginning to this peevish odds;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And would in action glorious I had lost

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Those legs that brought me to a part of it!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: How comes it, Michael, you are thus forgot?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I pray you, pardon me; I cannot speak.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Worthy Montano, you were wont be civil;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The gravity and stillness of your youth

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The world hath noted, and your name is great

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: In mouths of wisest censure: what's the matter,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That you unlace your reputation thus

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And spend your rich opinion for the name

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Of a night-brawler? give me answer to it.

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Worthy Othello, I am hurt to danger:

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Your officer, Iago, can inform you,--

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: While I spare speech, which something now

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: offends me,--

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Of all that I do know: nor know I aught

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: By me that's said or done amiss this night;

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Unless self-charity be sometimes a vice,

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: And to defend ourselves it be a sin

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: When violence assails us.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Now, by heaven,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: My blood begins my safer guides to rule;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And passion, having my best judgment collied,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Assays to lead the way: if I once stir,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Or do but lift this arm, the best of you

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Shall sink in my rebuke. Give me to know

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: How this foul rout began, who set it on;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And he that is approved in this offence,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Though he had twinn'd with me, both at a birth,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Shall lose me. What! in a town of war,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Yet wild, the people's hearts brimful of fear,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To manage private and domestic quarrel,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: In night, and on the court and guard of safety!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: 'Tis monstrous. Iago, who began't?

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: If partially affined, or leagued in office,

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Thou dost deliver more or less than truth,

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Thou art no soldier.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Touch me not so near:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I had rather have this tongue cut from my mouth

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Than it should do offence to Michael Cassio;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Yet, I persuade myself, to speak the truth

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Shall nothing wrong him. Thus it is, general.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Montano and myself being in speech,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: There comes a fellow crying out for help:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And Cassio following him with determined sword,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To execute upon him. Sir, this gentleman

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Steps in to Cassio, and entreats his pause:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Myself the crying fellow did pursue,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Lest by his clamour--as it so fell out--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: The town might fall in fright: he, swift of foot,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Outran my purpose; and I return'd the rather

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: For that I heard the clink and fall of swords,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And Cassio high in oath; which till to-night

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I ne'er might say before. When I came back--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: For this was brief--I found them close together,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: At blow and thrust; even as again they were

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: When you yourself did part them.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: More of this matter cannot I report:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But men are men; the best sometimes forget:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Though Cassio did some little wrong to him,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As men in rage strike those that wish them best,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Yet surely Cassio, I believe, received

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: From him that fled some strange indignity,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Which patience could not pass.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I know, Iago,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Thy honesty and love doth mince this matter,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Making it light to Cassio. Cassio, I love thee

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: But never more be officer of mine.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Re-enter DESDEMONA, attended

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Look, if my gentle love be not raised up!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I'll make thee an example.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: What's the matter?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: All's well now, sweeting; come away to bed.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Sir, for your hurts, myself will be your surgeon:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Lead him off.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To MONTANO, who is led off

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Iago, look with care about the town,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And silence those whom this vile brawl distracted.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Come, Desdemona: 'tis the soldiers' life

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To have their balmy slumbers waked with strife.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Exeunt all but IAGO and CASSIO

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What, are you hurt, lieutenant?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Ay, past all surgery.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Marry, heaven forbid!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Reputation, reputation, reputation! O, I have lost

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: my reputation! I have lost the immortal part of

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: myself, and what remains is bestial. My reputation,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Iago, my reputation!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As I am an honest man, I thought you had received

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: some bodily wound; there is more sense in that than

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: in reputation. Reputation is an idle and most false

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: imposition: oft got without merit, and lost without

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: deserving: you have lost no reputation at all,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: unless you repute yourself such a loser. What, man!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: there are ways to recover the general again: you

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: are but now cast in his mood, a punishment more in

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: policy than in malice, even so as one would beat his

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: offenceless dog to affright an imperious lion: sue

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: to him again, and he's yours.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I will rather sue to be despised than to deceive so

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: good a commander with so slight, so drunken, and so

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: indiscreet an officer. Drunk? and speak parrot?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: and squabble? swagger? swear? and discourse

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: fustian with one's own shadow? O thou invisible

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: spirit of wine, if thou hast no name to be known by,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: let us call thee devil!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What was he that you followed with your sword? What

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: had he done to you?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I know not.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Is't possible?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I remember a mass of things, but nothing distinctly;

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: a quarrel, but nothing wherefore. O God, that men

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: should put an enemy in their mouths to steal away

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: their brains! that we should, with joy, pleasance

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: revel and applause, transform ourselves into beasts!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Why, but you are now well enough: how came you thus

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: recovered?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: It hath pleased the devil drunkenness to give place

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: to the devil wrath; one unperfectness shows me

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: another, to make me frankly despise myself.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Come, you are too severe a moraler: as the time,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: the place, and the condition of this country

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: stands, I could heartily wish this had not befallen;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: but, since it is as it is, mend it for your own good.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I will ask him for my place again; he shall tell me

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I am a drunkard! Had I as many mouths as Hydra,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: such an answer would stop them all. To be now a

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: sensible man, by and by a fool, and presently a

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: beast! O strange! Every inordinate cup is

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: unblessed and the ingredient is a devil.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Come, come, good wine is a good familiar creature,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: if it be well used: exclaim no more against it.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And, good lieutenant, I think you think I love you.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I have well approved it, sir. I drunk!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: You or any man living may be drunk! at a time, man.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I'll tell you what you shall do. Our general's wife

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: is now the general: may say so in this respect, for

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: that he hath devoted and given up himself to the

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: contemplation, mark, and denotement of her parts and

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: graces: confess yourself freely to her; importune

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: her help to put you in your place again: she is of

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: so free, so kind, so apt, so blessed a disposition,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: she holds it a vice in her goodness not to do more

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: than she is requested: this broken joint between

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: you and her husband entreat her to splinter; and, my

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: fortunes against any lay worth naming, this

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: crack of your love shall grow stronger than it was before.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: You advise me well.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I protest, in the sincerity of love and honest kindness.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I think it freely; and betimes in the morning I will

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: beseech the virtuous Desdemona to undertake for me:

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I am desperate of my fortunes if they cheque me here.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: You are in the right. Good night, lieutenant; I

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: must to the watch.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: CASSIO: Good night, honest Iago.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And what's he then that says I play the villain?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: When this advice is free I give and honest,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Probal to thinking and indeed the course

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To win the Moor again? For 'tis most easy

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: The inclining Desdemona to subdue

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: In any honest suit: she's framed as fruitful

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As the free elements. And then for her

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To win the Moor--were't to renounce his baptism,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: All seals and symbols of redeemed sin,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: His soul is so enfetter'd to her love,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That she may make, unmake, do what she list,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Even as her appetite shall play the god

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: With his weak function. How am I then a villain

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To counsel Cassio to this parallel course,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Directly to his good? Divinity of hell!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: When devils will the blackest sins put on,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: They do suggest at first with heavenly shows,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As I do now: for whiles this honest fool

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Plies Desdemona to repair his fortunes

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And she for him pleads strongly to the Moor,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I'll pour this pestilence into his ear,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That she repeals him for her body's lust;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And by how much she strives to do him good,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: She shall undo her credit with the Moor.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: So will I turn her virtue into pitch,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And out of her own goodness make the net

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That shall enmesh them all.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Re-enter RODERIGO

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: How now, Roderigo!

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: I do follow here in the chase, not like a hound that

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: hunts, but one that fills up the cry. My money is

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: almost spent; I have been to-night exceedingly well

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: cudgelled; and I think the issue will be, I shall

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: have so much experience for my pains, and so, with

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: no money at all and a little more wit, return again to Venice.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: How poor are they that have not patience!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What wound did ever heal but by degrees?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Thou know'st we work by wit, and not by witchcraft;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And wit depends on dilatory time.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Does't not go well? Cassio hath beaten thee.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And thou, by that small hurt, hast cashier'd Cassio:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Though other things grow fair against the sun,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Yet fruits that blossom first will first be ripe:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Content thyself awhile. By the mass, 'tis morning;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Pleasure and action make the hours seem short.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Retire thee; go where thou art billeted:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Away, I say; thou shalt know more hereafter:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Nay, get thee gone.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Exit RODERIGO

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Two things are to be done:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: My wife must move for Cassio to her mistress;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I'll set her on;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Myself the while to draw the Moor apart,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And bring him jump when he may Cassio find

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Soliciting his wife: ay, that's the way

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Dull not device by coldness and delay.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Exit
